Ryo Kato

Ryo Kato is a MS student in the department of computer science at the University of Southern California (USC).

He is interested in web application development, site reliability, automated testing, continuous integration, and mobile phone app development.

Detail

Ryo Kato is a graduate student in the Viterbi School of Engineering at the University of Southern California.

He received his bachelor's degree in Agriculture from Kyoto University in 2012. However, he was interested in computer science and software development more than agriculture, so he changed his major.

He studied web task search at Tanaka Laboratory, and received his master's degree in Informatics from Kyoto University in 2014.

He worked for DeNA, which is a large Internet company in Japan, for three years from 2014 to 2017 as a software engineer, and developed end-to-end testing frameworks for web apps and chromium-based native apps.

He wanted to study theoretical computer science so quitted his job and became a graduate student at USC in 2017.

He develops software including web apps, iOS apps, and libraries as his personal projects.

He hopes to work as a software engineer who deals with huge amount of data in the United States.
